biotools.summary: Identification of new minor intron-containing genes and tissue-dependent retention and alternative splicing of minor introns | Welcome to the minor intron database (MIDB)! | Minor introns, or U12-type introns, were initially identified based on their divergent terminal dinucleotide sequences (Jackson, 1991) | MIDB contains the most recent information on minor introns and the genes they are found in, also called MIGs (minor intron-containing genes) | Species: Mus musculus Homo sapiens All

bioschemas.name: MIDB
